page.title: 05VALE OF CLWYD CATTLE FARMING
page.content: There is considerable variety in size of herd and breed of cattle in this area.For example,one farm runs a suckling herd with a{Charolais bull & {Hereford Cross}cows,plus bought_in calves.They make hay,& for the first time this year,silage.On another dairy farm of 100 acres,on the banks of the River Clwyd no grain or rootcrops are grown.Hay & silage are produced for the 58 milking cows & 60 young stock.Another 170 acre farm supports 110 dairy{Friesians}on silage & barley.A large estate also has a suckling herd.The cows are{Welsh Black type cattle.Home produced and brought in calves include Charolais crosses.Store cattle purchased for fattening include{Aberdeen Angus crosses.Bulls_Friesian Hereford Charolais.The A.1.service is also used.
